The problem seems network related, and the main issue is that afterwards the client (run via docker) was completely unresponsive and I couldn't even kill it. This is very inconvenient, as I have to restart the whole server to free up the locked network ports.

Maybe there is some network IO deadlock behind this?

Hey @torfbolt looks like the process was probably extremely resource constrained, which is what we were observing around the time this issue was opened. We have since then pushed a lot of great improvements to master to reduce resource utilization and should help avoid any of these problems. Let us know if you face them again.
